channel.title: Help or tut needed
channel.description:
hi i need help or a working tut on how to :::
1.fixh darkbow so it does shoot correctly on a ajscape server.
and
2.make specs or whip dds dlong d scimmy and d bow work.
u can leave a tut hear or help me step by step or just leave a url providing the answers.ty if u help and not ignore.

item.title: Help or tut needed
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

Ooo, i know!.. Add this to your attack method!

		int offsetX = (absX - EnemyX) * -1;
		int offsetY = (absY - EnemyY) * -1;

;)… If you get 1 error or 2… Delete the one that says.

		int offsetX = (casterX - EnemyX) * -1;
		int offsetY = (casterY - EnemyY) * -1;

Or something like that… Then, aswell in your attack method. Add this


		int EnemyX = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absX;
		int EnemyY = PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].absY;

If you dont alrady have it

item.title: Help or tut needed
item.dc:creator: @zxr3d_h0txz zxr3d h0txz
item.description:
@zxr3d_h0txz wrote:

what?[br][size=1]Posted on: September 27, 2007, 04:25:58 PM[/size][hr]any1 please help and tell me where to put this???

public void createProjectile(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int lockon)
{
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
{
if(p != null)
{
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != “null”))
{
if(person.distanceToPoint(casterX, casterY) <= 10)
{
person.createProjectile3(casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, angle, speed, gfxMoving, startHeight, endHeight, lockon);
}
}
}
}
}
public void createProjectile3(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int lockon) {
outStream.createFrame(85);
outStream.writeByteC((casterY - (mapRegionY * 8)) - 2);
outStream.writeByteC((casterX - (mapRegionX * 8)) - 3);
outStream.createFrame(117);
outStream.writeByte(angle); //Starting place of the projectile
outStream.writeByte(offsetY); //Distance between caster and enemy Y
outStream.writeByte(offsetX); //Distance between caster and enemy X
outStream.writeWord(lockon); //The NPC the missle is locked on to
outStream.writeWord(gfxMoving); //The moving graphic ID
outStream.writeByte(startHeight); //The starting height
outStream.writeByte(endHeight); //Destination height
outStream.writeWord(51); //Time the missle is created
outStream.writeWord(speed); //Speed minus the distance making it set
outStream.writeByte(16); //Initial slope
outStream.writeByte(64); //Initial distance from source (in the direction of the missile) //64
}
[br][size=1]Posted on: September 27, 2007, 05:25:12 PM[/size][hr]can any1 please tell me wher eto put this?ive had this topic for over 2 days now…

Read full topic

item.title: Help or tut needed
item.dc:creator: @LeScape LeScape
item.description:
@LeScape wrote:

add these

public void createProjectile(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int lockon)
{
for (Player p : server.playerHandler.players)
{
if(p != null) 
{
client person = (client)p;
if((person.playerName != null || person.playerName != "null"))
{
if(person.distanceToPoint(casterX, casterY) <= 10)
{
	person.createProjectile3(casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, angle, speed, gfxMoving, startHeight, endHeight, lockon);
	}
	}
	}
	}
	}
public void createProjectile3(int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int gfxMoving, int startHeight, int endHeight, int lockon) {
                outStream.createFrame(85);
                outStream.writeByteC((casterY - (mapRegionY * 8)) - 2);
                outStream.writeByteC((casterX - (mapRegionX * 8)) - 3);
                outStream.createFrame(117);
                outStream.writeByte(angle);                     //Starting place of the projectile
                outStream.writeByte(offsetY);               //Distance between caster and enemy Y
                outStream.writeByte(offsetX);                //Distance between caster and enemy X
                outStream.writeWord(lockon);        //The NPC the missle is locked on to
                outStream.writeWord(gfxMoving);             //The moving graphic ID
                outStream.writeByte(startHeight);           //The starting height
                outStream.writeByte(endHeight);             //Destination height
                outStream.writeWord(51);                        //Time the missle is created
                outStream.writeWord(speed);                     //Speed minus the distance making it set
                outStream.writeByte(16);                        //Initial slope
                outStream.writeByte(64);                        //Initial distance from source (in the direction of the missile) //64    
    }

Oh, and to this.

Rediculous Tbh... He/You had to use Msb special.......... Can't make on from scratch?..
100% pathetic...you didn't make yours from scratch either. Unless you make every method that your code uses...with NO work from anyone else, it's not from scratch.

item.title: Help or tut needed
item.dc:creator: @X-J-K-X X-J-K-X
item.description:
@X-J-K-X wrote:

[quote=“Moparrsplaya, post:4, topic:146650”]EDITED! DBOW SPEC

public void MBSSpecial()
}
if(IsAttackingNPC && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 11785 && SpecialDelay >= 4)
{
int EnemyX = server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].absX;
int EnemyY = server.npcHandler.npcs[attacknpc].absY;
int offsetX = (absX - EnemyX) * -1;
int offsetY = (absY - EnemyY) * -1;
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 536, 43, 31, 0 - AttackingOn);
magespec = true;
true;
arrowattack = 8;
teleportToX = absX;
teleportToY = absY;
sendMessage(“You quickly shoot two arrows at the enemy.”);
SpecialDelay -= 4;
} else if(IsAttacking && playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 11785 && SpecialDelay >= 4 && (].inwildy || PlayerHandler.players[AttackingOn].inwildy2) || (duelStatus == 3))
{

  • X) * -1;
    int offsetY = (absY - Y) * -1;
    SpecDamg(49);

      magespectimer = 2;
absX;
      teleportToY = absY;
      
  if(You dont have enough power."); }
  getFilling();

    }

All Creds to Vengence[/quote]

Rediculous Tbh… He/You had to use Msb special… Can’t make on from scratch?..

–

Ok zxr3d, firstly to make darkbow shoot like a bow.

Open client.java and search for “861”… Keep searching until you find something like…

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 861)
{
 PkingDelay = 15;
 wepdelay = 15;
 UseBow = true; 
}

Add this underneath it…

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 11785)
{
 PkingDelay = 15;
 wepdelay = 15;
 UseBow = true; 
}

Keep finding “861” … Eventually you will come across something like…

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 839 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 841  || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4827 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 843 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 845 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 847 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 849 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 851 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 853 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 855 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 857)
{
  PkingDelay = 15;
  wepdelay = 15;
  UseBow = true;
}

Or…

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 839 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 841  || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 4827 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 843 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 845 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 847 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 849 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 851 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 853 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 855 || playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 857)
{
  UseBow = true;
}

I recomend short’ning that down alot… Lol, less client.java space. Alright, on the end of that, (Delete the last “)” )

Then add…

|| playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 11785)

Okay now, to add a projectile… Go back to the code you just added…

if(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] == 11785)
{
 PkingDelay = 15;
 wepdelay = 15;
 UseBow = true; 
}

Underneath UseBow = true; if you have the correct void for this. Add this …

createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 43, 31, 0 - AttackingOn);

I dont use that… You’ll see why when you add it. The 50 stands for the angle…
80 is the speed that the arrow shoots.
249 is the arrow gfx.
43 is the starting height.
31 is the ending height…
0 - AttackingOn is the lockon i think…
– Anyway, if you wanna add double projectile, like runescape. Add this underneath UseBow = true;

createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 60, 31, AttackingOn + 1);
createProjectile(absY, absX, offsetX, offsetY, 50, 80, 249, 43, 31, AttackingOn + 1);

That will make 2 arrows shoot @ the same time, one on top of another…

NOTE: This will not make it hit double. Just the projectile.

Hope this helps

Read full topic
